Raw description:  Coordinate and supervise employee teams and subcontractors. Schedule day to day movements of all crews with Scheduling Co-ordinator. Coordinate materials needed for various jobs throughout the day. Coordinate and schedule maintenance and repairs to fleet equipment. Assist management in designing and implementing systems in an orchestrated and documented fashion. Ensure all Health and Safety policies are followed on the job sites. Assist Commercial and Residential sales team with site inspections as required. This involves on-site measurements, reviewing maps and amending work orders as required. Candidate should have a strong employment record with experience in construction. Civil Engineering background will be preferred. Valid G License. Able and willing to work Overtime and Weekends. Strong mechanical background and attention to detail. Maintain an owner’s representative mentality in day to day interactions. Ability to work in a fast past environment. High level of experience in planning, communicating with sub-trades, managing clients and clients’ expectations; Strong communication skills, both oral and written; Excellent proficiency using Microsoft Excel and Word. Must be willing to work on projects in Southwestern Ontario, if required. Construction: 5 years Bachelor's Class G Construction Project Manager Our client is a well-established Design-Build Firm and developer with over 47 years’ of experience that focuses on the Southwestern Ontario area based out of Windsor, ON. They are currently hiring a permanent Construction Project Manager and the ideal candidate will have at least 5 years’ of experience working on commercial and industrial projects.
